text: The Charlemagne Prize () is a famous prize awarded each year.Spiegel The prize has been awarded since 1950 by the German city of Aachen. It is awarded to persons who have done outstanding work towards the unification of Europe. The award is named after Charlemagne, emperor of the Frankish Empire, and founder of what became the Holy Roman Empire. Charlemagne lived and was buried in Aachen. ==References== ==Other websites== *Charlemagne Prize Category:1950 establishments in Europe Category:Awards Category:Aachen Category:1950s establishments in Germany Category:European culture Category:German culture
title: Charlemagne Prize
